channel.title: Good and Evil
channel.description:
-not sure if there is already a thread for this-
Does Good and evil actually exist? Or is it rather a false preconception? I do believe that morality depends on what type of environment an individual's exposed to;or someone's mental state. So, who or what exactly determines what's right or wrong?
Thoughts?

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @ruzylo Ruzylo
item.description:
@ruzylo wrote:

Yes but is usually sperated and decided on peoples opinions and moral beliefs.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

In my opinion good and evil are theoretical concepts - there is simply not a cut and dry definition that fits all situations and all cultures. However, personally I believe there exists an evil. Said evil is those who in their lives follow the opposite of the golden rule.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:12, topic:537246”][quote author=Frell link=topic=656062.msg4394962#msg4394962 date=1388845142]

evil is sentencing your uncle to be executed by being eaten alive by 120 savage dogs starved for 3 days

north korea is not best korea

Ignorant is to believe everything you read in the newspapers.

“seems like a very NK thing to do”
[/quote]
This is the basis of anti-DPRK propaganda. They make fake stories like this and people believe them because of all the previous fake stories.[/quote]

Very true. I read somewhere before he died, Kim Jong il had people believe he invented the hamburger, he was the best golfer in the world, his military fashion sense has influenced world wide, and that he does not urinate or defecate… Propoganda in NK is strong.

back on topic though, I can see how right and wrong change over time as well, but it’s the basic rights and wrongs as a adolescent that a lot of people in my city had to pick from. For those of you who don’t know Baltimore is often referred to as the heroin capital of the US. While I personally believe there are worse places than here, crime is still high. A lot of teens in this area have seen their family struggle, being on welfare and drugs, and no other life than a life of crime. They think that by robbing killing and dealing dope, they’re being “men”, and “surviving”. I was in the same situation as them, and knew I couldn’t go down that path. If I wanted to lift my family out of the city, I would go to school and make something of myself. And it’s exactly what I’m doing now.

So yes, even though rights and wrongs change over time, the basics will always be there.

Read full topic

Good and evil are just ideas or labels, and can therefore not exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

If death is something that is going to come anyways, and that we evade sometimes by luck or whatever, it’s nothing to worry about, the time will come.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Good and evil exist for those who use the terms I guess, though they are just morals.
Morals aren’t real either imo, they are just an emotional reaction, that you learned as a kid through education and your parents.
Do they change when you get older and think more for yourself, but everybody still has the base morals coming from when they were kids.
Why do we cry for the death while other cultures party or just ignore it? What is right and wrong?
I guess what you believe yourself is right.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

God and Devil.
Well i have a simple question, you can be doing something “Evil” for alot of people but, probably they do not know the background so the question is… Does the ending justifies the means?
Probably You’re to be killed, or you’re family is to, you have to act! but You’ll do bad stuff, its all about where you are standing right now.
You don’t have other’s people shoes to step in and see what they’re doing, but there are things that are, well that i could consider bad, but it’d be like killing somone for no reason ya knw?

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

What is right and wrong changes over time. Just look to history and you will see that. Right and wrong is a concept created by mankind. So is good and evil. Both dichotomies were created by mankind which is why it is sometimes hard to discern what is right or what is wrong. You would say killing is wrong, but it depends on the context. We kill all the time during war. Does that make it right?

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

I agree, the environment in which an individual was raised has ALOT to do with the choices they make, and in which direction their morality pulls. However, coming from someone born and raised in the Southside of Baltimore City, I was exposed to the same dangers as many other kids I grew up with. Difference is, I made it out by knowing right from wrong, and who to get involved with and who not to get involved with. Every human being is born with a conscience , it’s a matter of using it.

Read full topic

item.title: Good and Evil
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Right or wrong. It’s all about thought really. If you like to see life as a wonderful and precious thing to have then taking a life would be considered evil. Though, if you genuinely think the world is against you and nothing is worth fight or living for then taking a life wouldn’t be such a big deal. Murder is only an example of this. There are many actions and beliefs that can twist the arrow.

Read full topic
